design_audit.treatment_timing: Continuous DiD: pre-vaccine measles incidence rate interacted with cohort-level vaccine exposure (0-16 years of exposure)
design_audit.estimand: ATT (effect of measles vaccine exposure on adult labor market outcomes, scaled by pre-vaccine measles rate)
design_audit.comparison_groups: Cohorts born before 1949 (no vaccine exposure) vs cohorts born 1949-1963+ (partial to full exposure), cross-state variation in pre-vaccine measles incidence
design_audit.panel_unit: individual (repeated cross-sections by birth-state x birth-year)

claim_object.outcome_concept: Adult labor market outcomes: wage income (CPI-adjusted), log income, poverty status, employment, hours worked
claim_object.treatment_concept: Measles vaccine exposure: M12_exp_rate = (avg 12-year pre-vaccine measles incidence rate for birth state) x (years of childhood vaccine exposure based on birth year), scaled by 100,000
claim_object.estimand_concept: Effect of measles vaccine exposure on adult labor market outcomes, identified from cross-state variation in pre-vaccine measles incidence interacted with cohort-level vaccine timing
claim_object.target_population: Native-born black and white US adults aged 25-59, observed in ACS 2000-2017, born 1941-1980

constraints.functional_form_note: The treatment variable M12_exp_rate is continuous, constructed from avg_12yr_measles_rate * exposure / 100000. Alternative treatment constructions use different pre-vaccine averaging windows (M2 through M11).
linkage_notes: Core DiD FE (bpl, birthyr, year) are design-critical and must not be dropped
When restricting to men_only or women_only, drop bpl_female and bpl_black_female FE interactions
When restricting to white_only or black_only, drop bpl_black and bpl_black_female FE interactions
Joint specs (rc/joint/) handle these sample+FE linkages explicitly
black and female appear as both level controls and FE-interaction components -- LOO drops them as level controls only

canonical.notes: Cluster-robust SEs at birth-state x birth-year cohort level, matching the paper's baseline

variants.notes: Cluster at birth state level (coarser, fewer clusters)
Cluster at birth-state x exposure level
Cluster at census region level (4 regions -- very few clusters)
Cluster at census division level (9 divisions)
Cluster at state-of-residence x exposure level (from AppendixTable3)
Cluster at state-of-residence x birth-year (from AppendixTable3)
